intro: Galium kinuta var. bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
